sentences.text: December 16, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are invited to attend our annual meeting of stockholders at 9:00 a.m. local time, January 27, 2017, at the Westin  Atlanta Perimeter North, 7 Concourse Parkway, Atlanta, Georgia 30328.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enclosed you will find a meeting notice, a related proxy statement, a proxy or voting instruction card and our 2016  annual report to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you are able to attend the annual meeting, we encourage you to read   the materials and promptly vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 represented WestRock Companys first full fiscal year following the transformative merger of RockTenn and  MeadWestvaco in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, we focused on three key areas to drive growth and generate value for our  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pursued our differentiated strategy based on delivering winning solutions to our customers and realizing the benefits of our broad product offerings, capabilities and geographic footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We executed our merger integration initiatives and realized significant synergy and performance  improvements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintained a balanced capital allocation program focused on investing in our business and returning capita to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We performed well in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generated $1.7 billion of net cash provided by operating activities, and captured   $384 million of productivity improvements to achieve an annualized run rate of $500 million at September 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the strength of our cash flow, we deployed $588 million to strategic opportunities that enhance our product  portfolio, strengthen our presence in targeted markets and expand our global platform, all of which better position us  for future growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included the acquisition of SP Fiber Holdings, Inc. in October 2015, the acquisition of Cenveo  Inc.s packaging business in January 2016 and the acquisition of a 25% interest in Gondi, S.A. De C.V., a joint venture  that enabled the further expansion of our business in the attractive Mexican market, in April 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we achieved several strategic priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We successfully completed the separation of our specialty  chemicals business in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The separation has allowed us to better focus on our core businesses and markets,  and has been well received by our stockholders, who have further benefited from significant appreciation in the shares  since the spin-off.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And in September 2016, we successfully transferred payment responsibility for retirement benefits  owed to certain retirees and their beneficiaries to an insurer, thereby reducing our overall U.S. pension obligations by  approximately 40%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we returned $716 million to our stockholders through dividends and share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the strategic combination of RockTenn and MeadWestvaco in July 2015, we assembled a talented  and experienced group of directors who bring a wide range of relevant skills and expertise to our boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A large  part of our success can be attributed to our board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee recommended all directors for reelection at the annual  meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: G. Stephen Felker and Larry Gellerstedt have decided not to stand for reelection, citing the successful  completion of our first full year and our strong prospects going forward, along with the size of the Board and their long  tenures on the boards of RockTenn and WestRock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I thank Stephen and Larry for their years of outstanding service to  the Board and their sound advice and counsel to the management of RockTenn and WestRock, as we have grown from a  $1.3 billion revenue company in 1998 to a $14 billion revenue company in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather than nominate successors, the  Board will reduce the size of the Board  from 14 to 12 directors immediately following their retirements from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made good progress in 2016, and we are confident we will continue to deliver value for our stockholders as we  leverage the unique opportunity created by our combined businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your continued support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Very truly yours,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steven C. Voorhees Chief Executive Officer and President
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD COMPOSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board consists of 14 directors, eight of whom previously served on the Rock-Tenn Company board of directors and six of whom  previously served on the MeadWestvaco Corporation board of directors; however, it is expected that Messrs. Felker and Gellerstedt will  retire from the Board effective at the annual meeting of stockholders scheduled for January 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather than nominate successors, the  Board will reduce the size of the Board  from 14 to 12 directors immediately following their retirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are elected each year at  the annual meeting of stockholders to hold office until the next annual meeting and until their successors are elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Guidelines and the corporate governance listing standards of the NYSE (the NYSE Standards), the Board must consist of a  majority of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board annually reviews director independence under standards set forth in the Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director  is independent under the Guidelines only if he or she satisfies all of the standards for independence regarding directors set forth in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the  NYSE Standards and other applicable NYSE rules,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) final rules and regulations adopted by the SEC and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) all other applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has affirmatively determined that all director nominees, other than Messrs. Luke and Voorhees, are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr.  Luke is not independent because he was an employee of MeadWestvaco immediately prior to the effective date of the Combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Voorhees is not independent because he is an employee of WestRock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the normal course of business, we purchase products and services from many suppliers and we sell products and services  to many customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some cases, these transactions occur with companies with which Board members have relationships as  directors or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board members also have relationships as directors or executive officers with companies that hold  or held our securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined these, and similar, relationships were not material (individually or collectively) for  purposes of its affirmative determinations of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for evaluating and recommending candidates for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After completing its  evaluation of candidates, the Governance Committee presents its recommendations to the Board for consideration and approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Committee  considers candidates  qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Committee  recommends candidates  to Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee periodically assesses the Board to ensure that it has the right mix of experience, qualifications and  skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee also periodically assesses the appropriate size of the Board and whether any vacancies on  the Board are expected due to retirement or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no vacancies are anticipated, the Governance Committee considers  the qualifications of incumbent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If vacancies arise or are anticipated, the Governance Committee considers various  potential candidates for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates may come to the attention of the Governance Committee through current directors,  professional search firms and advisors or other persons, including our stockholders  nominations for director candidates are closed  for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To recommend a candidate for next years annual meeting of stockholders, a stockholder must deliver  or mail its nomination submission to WestRock Company, 504 Thrasher Street, Norcross, Georgia 30071, Attention: Corporate  Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations must be received by October 29, 2017 and must include the information specified in our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee evaluates potential candidates against the standards and qualifications set forth in the Guidelines,  as well as other relevant factors it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Listed below are the skills and experience that we consider important for  our director nominees in light of our current business and structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors biographies note each directors relevant  experience, qualifications and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Global Business Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mergers & Acquisitions Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience working outside the United States and/or with global  companies to help oversee the management of our global operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience working on M&A transactions to provide insight  into developing and implementing strategies for growing our  businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public Company CEO Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public Company Board Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capital Allocation Experience Experience with capital allocation decision-making to help us  allocate capital efficiently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each potential candidate must:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be free of conflicts of interest and other legal and ethical issues that would interfere with the proper performance of the responsibilities of a director (recognizing that some directors may also be executive officers of the Company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be committed to discharging directors duties in accordance with the Guidelines and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be willing and able to devote sufficient time and energy to carrying out the directors duties effectively and be committed  to serving on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Have sufficient experience to enable the director to meaningfully participate in deliberations of the Board and one or more of its committees, and to otherwise fulfill the directors duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not have a specific diversity policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board strives to select candidates for Board membership who represent  a mix of diverse experience, background and thought at policy-making levels that are relevant to our activities, as well as other  characteristics that will contribute to the overall ability of the Board to perform its duties and meet changing conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee regularly considers the long-term composition of the Board and how its members change over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established a retirement age for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must retire when they reach age 72, provided a director may  continue to serve until the next annual or special meeting of stockholders at which the director is to be elected after he or she  reaches age 72 and, on an exceptional basis, the Board may extend a directors term for a limited period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has not established term limits because it believes that, on balance, term limits would sacrifice the contribution  of directors who have been able to develop over a period of time increasing insight into us and our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the  Governance Committee evaluates the qualifications and performance of each incumbent director before recommending his or her  nomination for an additional term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a director who has a significant change in his or her full time job responsibilities must  submit a letter of resignation resigning from the Board and each committee on which he or she serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The submission of a letter  of resignation provides an opportunity for the Board to review the continued appropriateness of the directors membership on the  Board and each applicable committee under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors are elected by a majority of the votes cast for them in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a director does not receive a greater  number of for votes than against votes, then the director must tender his or her resignation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board then  determines whether to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors are elected by a plurality vote standard in contested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over-Boarding Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors may not serve on more than four other public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director who serves  as a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) CEO must limit his or her other public company directorships to two and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After many years of distinguished service, it is expected that Messrs. Felker and Gellerstedt will retire from the Board effective at the  annual meeting of stockholders scheduled for January 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We would like to take this opportunity to thank them both for many  years of service to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather than nominate successors, the Board will reduce the size of the Board  from 14 to 12 directors  immediately following their resignations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After evaluating each director and the composition of the Board, the Governance Committee recommended all of the current  directors for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Felker and Gellerstedt subsequently notified us of their decisions not to stand for reelection, and the  Governance Committee then recommended for election the 12 director nominees listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If elected, each of the 12 nominees  will hold office until the next annual meeting of stockholders and until his or her successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee  has agreed to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If for some unforeseen reason a nominee becomes unwilling or unable to serve, proxies  will be voted as recommended by the Board to elect substitute nominees recommended by the Board or allow the vacancy created  to remain open until filled by the Board, or the Board may determine not to elect substitute nominees and may instead determine to  reduce the size of the Board.

sentences.text: BOARD OPERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bylaws separate the roles of CEO and non-executive chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Voorhees serves as our CEO and President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  this role, he has general supervision of our business and affairs and he is recognized as our leader to business partners, employees,  stockholders and other parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Luke serves as our non-executive chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this role, he provides oversight, direction and  leadership to the Board and facilitates communication among directors and the regular flow of information between management  and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the non-executive chairman:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serves as the chair of the Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presides at Board and stockholder meetings and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides input to the Compensation Committee and Governance Committee, as appropriate, with respect to the CEO  performance evaluation process, the annual Board performance self-evaluation process and Board succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead independent director is selected from among the directors and serves a one-year term provided no director may serve more than two consecutive terms, unless the Board determines  otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead independent director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhancement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board created  a standing lead  independent director  role, and appointed  James Nevels as lead  independent director in September 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presides at all meetings of the Board at which the non-executive chairman is not present,  including executive sessions of the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: may call meetings of the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serves as a liaison between the non-executive chairman and the independent directors and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if requested by a major stockholder, ensures he or she is available for consultation and direct  communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conduct consistent stockholder outreach throughout the year to ensure management and the Board understand and consider the  issues that matter most to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we provide regular updates regarding our performance and strategic actions  to the investor community, and we participate in numerous investor conferences, one-on-one meetings, site visits, earnings calls and  educational investor and analyst conversations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, we engaged a third party to conduct interviews of several large current  and prospective stockholders, and sell-side research analysts in order to better understand the perceptions of WestRock among the  investor community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We plan to use the insights derived from these interviews to tailor our outreach efforts in fiscal 2017 and beyond to  ensure we continue to provide meaningful information to the investor community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See "Communicating with the Board."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board assigns responsibilities and delegates authority to its committees, and the committees regularly report on their  activities and actions to the Board.

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, the Board held eight meetings and committees of the Board held a total of 17 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of Non-Management Directors and Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-management directors meet separately from the other directors in regularly scheduled executive sessions in connection  with each Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These meetings are conducted without the presence of management directors or executive officers,  unless the non-management directors request the attendance of one or more members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least once a year, and at  such other times as may be scheduled by the non-executive chairman or the lead independent director, the independent directors  meet separately from the other directors in executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and each committee (other than the Executive Committee) conducts an annual self-evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance  Committee oversees the process and the implementation of the annual self-evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors complete detailed confidential questionnaires to provide feedback on the effectiveness of the Board, the committees  and the contributions of individual directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the questionnaires are compiled anonymously by the Secretary in the  form of summaries for the Board and each committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The feedback is reviewed and discussed by the Governance Committee (as it  relates to both the Board and all committees) and each other committee (as it relates to such committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n light of the opportunities and challenges presented by the Combination, the Board  augmented its self-evaluation process in fiscal 2016 to include one-on-one, in-person  discussions between the non-executive chairman and each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These discussions  ocused on Board effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the non-executive chairman solicited feedback  rom each director as to what attributes make for a highly effective board based on their  experiences with RockTenn, MeadWestvaco and other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-executive  chairman discussed the responses with the Chairman of the Governance Committee and with  he Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Governance Enhancement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-executive chairman  conducted one-on-one, in-person  discussions with each director  focused on Board effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to annual self-evaluations, the Board and each committee assess the overall effectiveness of each regular Board and  most committee meetings during the executive session related to those meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these assessments allow us to  continually improve the effectiveness of our Board and committee meetings throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Orientation and Continuing Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each new director participates in an orientation program and receives materials and briefings to acquaint him or her with our  business, strategies and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing education is provided for all directors through board materials and presentations, discussions with management, visits  to our facilities and other sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of our directors also attend programs focused on topics that are relevant to their duties as a  director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an informal policy of reimbursing our directors for the cost of one third-party continuing education program every  other year; however, our directors may be reimbursed for the costs of additional programs with the approval of the Chairman of the  Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, the Board visited our merchandising displays operations and a box plant located in Winston-Salem, North Carolina,  our newly-acquired kraft paper and containerboard mill located in Dublin, Georgia and our SBS mill located in Covington, Virginia, in each case in connection with meetings held in those locations, and six of our directors visited our operations in Brazil.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in  fiscal 2016, we arranged for third parties to deliver presentations to the Board concerning stockholder relations and the Foreign  Corrupt Practices Act and related statutes, among other topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board provides oversight of our risk management process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board executes its risk oversight function both as a whole and  through delegation to its key committees, each of which meets regularly and reports back to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each key committees risk oversight responsibilities are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board and its committees oversee risk management, management is charged with managing enterprise risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board  recognizes that it is neither possible nor desirable to eliminate all risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, the Board views appropriate risk taking as essential  to our long-term success and seeks to understand and oversee critical business risks in the context of our business strategy, the  magnitude of the particular risks and the proper allocation of our risk management and mitigation resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a robust internal control environment that facilitates the identification and management of risks and regular  communications with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees receive regular reports from members of senior management on  areas of material risk to us, including operational, financial, strategic, competitive, reputational, legal and regulatory risks, and how  those risks are managed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our general counsel informs each committee and the Board of relevant legal and compliance issues, and  each committee also has access to our outside counsel when it deems it advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee also has the authority to engage  independent counsel at our expense as it deems necessary to carry out its duties and responsibilities.

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership and Retention Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is required to own at least the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 5,000 shares of Common Stock or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a number of shares of  Common Stock having a value of not less than five times the annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining compliance with these guidelines,  stock ownership includes shares vested and unvested restricted stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have five years from the date of their initial  election to achieve the targeted level of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All current directors have achieved the targeted level of ownership, except certain directors who joined the board of RockTenn or  MeadWestvaco within the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors are required to retain 50% of the net restricted stock awarded to the individual for a period of two years following the  vesting of the restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retention period does not apply to any shares to the extent the recipient continues to own an  amount of Common Stock at least equal to the number of shares required under the preceding sentence, plus a number of shares  required to be held under our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require that each executive officer, director and director nominee complete an annual questionnaire and report all transactions  since the beginning of the last fiscal year that exceed $120,000 in which we were a participant and in which those persons (or their  associates or immediate family members) (collectively, "related parties") had or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reviews responses to the questionnaires and, if any such transactions are disclosed, the Governance Committee  then makes recommendations to the Board with respect to the appropriateness of such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a formal  written policy for approval or ratification of these transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information included in directors responses to the questionnaires is  reviewed annually by the Board for the purpose of assessing independence under the Guidelines, applicable rules and regulations  of the SEC and the NYSE Standards, and we review all responses to ensure that any such transactions adhere to the standards set  forth above as well as our various codes of conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not engage in any transaction during fiscal 2016, and have no currently  proposed transaction, in which the amount involved exceeds $120,000 and a related person had or will have a direct or indirect  material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is asking our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named  executive officers disclosed in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Recommendation: FOR the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required: An affirmative vote requires the majority of those shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled  to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules, our stockholders are being asked to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named  executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, more than 98% of the votes cast were in favor of the compensation  of our named executive officers ("NEOs").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 19, we believe our compensation policies  and procedures are competitive, focused on pay-for-performance principles and strongly aligned with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation philosophy is based on the belief that the compensation of our employees, including  our NEOs, should be set at levels that allow us to attract and retain employees who are committed to achieving high performance  and who demonstrate the ability to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our objectives include creating a clear path between realized compensation and the  successful execution of our business strategy and enhancing each individual executives performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to provide an  executive compensation package that is driven by our overall financial performance, increased stockholder value, the success of  areas of our business directly impacted by the executives performance and the performance of the individual executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We view  our compensation program as a strategic tool that supports the successful execution of our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program emphasizes long-term incentives over short-term incentives, with a significant portion  of total compensation weighted toward equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach allows us to align our executives interests with our  stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our aggregate total stockholder returns for the past three, five and ten fiscal years were 13.4%, 141.9% and  534.4%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program has been instrumental in helping us to achieve the strong  historical financial performance that has driven these returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on this resolution is not intended to address any specific element of compensation; rather, it relates to the overall  compensation of our NEOs, as well as the philosophy, policies and practices described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders  have the opportunity to vote for or against, or to abstain from voting on, the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys stockholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive  officers determined by the compensation committee, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis  section and the tabular disclosure regarding named executive officer compensation (together with the accompanying  narrative disclosure) in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the required vote is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will, however, take into  account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF ADVISORY VOTES    ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is asking our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Recommendation: FOR the option of every 1 year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required: The option of every 1 year, 2 years or 3 years that receives the highest number of affirmative votes by  those shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules, our stockholders may vote, on an advisory basis, on how frequently they would like to cast an advisory  vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes conducting an advisory vote on executive compensation on an annual  basis is currently appropriate for us and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders may cast a vote on the preferred voting frequency by selecting the option of 1 year, 2 years or 3 years, or they may  abstain from voting in response to the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys stockholders wish the Company to include an advisory vote on the compensation of the  Companys named executive officers pursuant to Section 14a of the Securities Exchange Act every:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: one year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: two years or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the required vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will, however, take into account the outcome  of the vote when considering the frequency with which we will provide our stockholders the opportunity to vote, on an advisory  basis, to approve the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section explains our compensation philosophy, summarizes our executive  compensation programs and discusses compensation decisions for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steven C. Voorhees CEO and President
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We view our executive compensation program as a strategic tool that supports the  successful execution of our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ward H. Dickson Executive Vice President  and CFO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has primary oversight over the design and execution of  our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our program is based on a pay-for-performance  model  it uses short-term incentives (STI) and long-term incentives (LTI) to drive  performance and align our executives and stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James B. Porter III President, Business  Development and Latin America
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee modified the metrics of our STI program in order to further align executive pay with our business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the  Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert A. Feeser
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: replaced operating income with EBITDA as a performance goal because it  believes EBITDA is a more relevant measure given the focus of investors on  EBITDA and EBITDA management and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey W. Chalovich President, Corrugated Packaging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: added productivity improvement goals to drive performance towards our  announced objective of realizing $1 billion in synergy and performance  improvements by the end of fiscal 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert K. Beckler
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: President, Packaging Solutions (Retired in July 2016)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the compensation paid to our NEOs for fiscal 2016 was commensurate  with our performance, and that our STI and LTI achieved their goals of motivating and  rewarding performance and aligning our executives and stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION GOVERNANCE AND PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pursued our differentiated strategy based on delivering winning solutions to our customers and realizing the benefits  of our broad product offerings, capabilities and geographic footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We executed our merger integration initiatives and realized significant synergy and performance improvements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintained a balanced capital allocation program focused on investing in our business and returning capital to our  stockholders.

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation philosophy is based on the belief that the compensation of our employees, including our NEOs,  should be set at levels that allow us to attract and retain employees who are committed to achieving high performance and who  demonstrate the ability to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our objectives include creating a clear path between realized compensation and the successful  execution of our business strategy and enhancing each executives performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to provide an executive compensation  package that is driven by our overall financial performance, increased stockholder value, the success of areas of our business  directly impacted by the executives performance and the executives performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core principles of our executive compensation  program include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall compensation must be competitive relative to other comparable organizations in order to attract and retain superior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial portion of total target direct compensation should be linked to variable at-risk pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTI should be used in addition to STI to encourage a focus on long-term strategy and execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should reflect an employees level of responsibility and contribution, and the greater the responsibility, the  greater the share of an employees compensation that should be at-risk with respect to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation should be used in addition to cash compensation to align our executives and stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay-for-Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is based on a pay-for-performance model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following graphs illustrate how we used the  executive compensation principles discussed above in the weighting of the target total direct compensation elements as in effect at  the end of fiscal 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO OTHER NEOs 71% 12% 17% 52% 25% 23%    Base  Bonus  LTI
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 88% of targeted total direct compensation for our CEO in fiscal  2016 was at risk, and only 12% of his compensation was fixed, ensuring a  strong link between his targeted total direct compensation and our financial  and operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An average of approximately 75% of targeted total direct  compensation for the other NEOs was at risk in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effectiveness
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our aggregate total stockholder returns for the past three, five and ten fiscal  years were 13.4%, 141.9% and 534.4%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive  compensation program has been instrumental in helping us to achieve the strong  historical financial performance that has driven these returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADMINISTRATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews competitive market data from a combination of a specific peer group of companies within  the paper and packaging industry, as well as other industries, and various published survey data for similarly sized companies  or business units in the non-durable goods manufacturing sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some cases, these surveys include all manufacturing or  general industry data, when non-durable goods manufacturing categories are not available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation  Committee selected a peer group based on the recommendation of its compensation consultant, which considered factors such as  revenue size, nature of business, talent market, organizational complexity and location.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fiscal 2016 peer group is identical to the  peer group used in fiscal 2015 following the Combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the competitive market data regarding base salary,  STI and LTI to assist directors in determining appropriate overall compensation levels,  but does not specifically benchmark to particular compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3M Company Alcoa Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ball Corporation Crown Holdings, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company Graphic Packaging Holding Company International Paper Company Kimberly-Clark Corporation Nucor Corporation Owens-Illinois Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Packaging Corporation of America Sealed Air Corporation United States Steel Corporation Weyerhaeuser Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summarizes the Compensation Committees approach to the various  components of executive compensation for our NEOs relative to the competitive market  data for executive talent discussed above:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary  Salaries are determined based on the executives responsibilities,  performance, experience and the Compensation Committees judgment  regarding competitive requirements and internal equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not target  a specific market data percentile for base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries are individually  determined and range broadly among our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI  STI opportunities are determined based on the executives individual  responsibilities and experience, and are individually set for each executive after  reviewing market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not target a specific market data percentile for  STI opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus opportunities range broadly among our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTI  In setting LTI award values, the Compensation Committee reviews market levels of LTI awards for the peer group  and other competitive market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviews the types and mix of LTI instruments used  by the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not target a specific market data percentile for LTI value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual LTI awards are based on  individual assessments, taking into account the executives responsibilities, performance, experience and other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee reviews competitive market data regarding the various components of compensation  for each NEO and certain other executives, the primary data point used to assess executive compensation is target total direct  compensation, which is comprised of the target total cash compensation (base salary and target STI opportunity), plus the target  amount of LTI awards, although we do not target a specific market data percentile for target total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our  peer group and survey data, in fiscal 2016 the target total direct compensation of our CEO was 103% of the market median, and the  target total direct compensation of our other NEOs ranged from 76% to 124% of the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has sole discretion to retain and obtain the advice of a compensation consultant, and is directly  responsible for the appointment, termination, compensation and oversight of the work of the compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Compensation Committee retains a compensation consultant to provide objective analysis, advice and information (including  competitive market data and compensation recommendations related to our CEO and our other senior executives) to the  Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant reports to the chairman of the Compensation Committee and has direct  access to the other members of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant attends all significant meetings of the  Compensation Committee and also meets with the Compensation Committee in person in executive sessions without management  present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retained Korn Ferry Hay Group to serve as its compensation consultant for fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December  2015, Hay Group, Inc. was acquired by Korn/Ferry International, a global people and organizational advisory firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal  2016, Korn Ferry provided us with recruiting services (primarily related to the separation of our specialty chemicals business) and  training services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engaged Korn Ferry to provide the recruiting services related to the separation of our specialty chemicals  business prior to its merger with Hay Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We paid Korn Ferry Hay Group $157,040 for rendering executive compensation  consulting services in fiscal 2016, and we paid Korn Ferry Hay Group $713,300 for rendering additional services in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management approved the additional services in the normal course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the work of Korn Ferry Hay Group did not raise any conflicts of interest in fiscal  2016, and believes the additional services provided by Korn Ferry Hay Group do not impair the objectivity of the advice rendered  by Korn Ferry Hay Group to the Compensation Committee on executive and director compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this  determination, the Compensation Committee considered the independence of Korn Ferry Hay Group in light of SEC rules and NYSE  listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers input from our CEO in making determinations regarding our overall executive  compensation program and the individual compensation of our senior executives, other than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the annual  planning process, our CEO develops targets for our annual bonus program and presents them to the Compensation Committee  for consideration, and, based on performance appraisals and information regarding competitive market practices provided by the  compensation consultant, recommends base salary adjustments, STI opportunities and LTI levels for our senior executives, other  than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each year, our CEO presents to the Compensation Committee and the directors his evaluation of each  senior executives contribution and performance over the past year, strengths and development needs and actions, and reviews  succession plans for each of our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting Compensation Levels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking into account advice and recommendations from our CEO and the compensation consultant, the Compensation  Committee determines what changes, if any, should be made to the executive compensation program and sets the level of  compensation for each senior executive with respect to each element of the compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting these levels, the  Compensation Committee reviews a detailed analysis of each senior executives annual total direct compensation (base salary,  target STI opportunity and the target amount of LTI awards), and the value of benefits under our retirement plans, including with  respect to the competitive market data discussed below, and reviews compensation tally sheets with respect to our most senior  executives that set forth each element of the executives compensation and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION ELEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a combination of pay elements and benefits to accomplish our executive compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI focuses on the  performance goals we believe drive stockholder value and for which our executives are responsible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTI are primarily equity based  and include a combination of performance-based restricted stock and performance-based stock units and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  believe LTI are critical in aligning our executives interests and stockholders interests and creating an effective retention measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Together, these incentives focus our executives on making decisions that will benefit our stockholders and our stock price over the  long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program includes the following primary components: base salary, STI, LTI and retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors Base Salary Annual Performance   Bonus (STI) Performance-Based  Stock and Stock  Units (LTI) Stock Options (LTI) Form of Compensation   Cash   Equity Fixed Performance-Based Performance-Based Performance-Based Performance Timing  Short-Term Emphasis Long-Term Emphasis Measurement Period Ongoing 1 year Vests at end of  3 year cycle Vests annually  over 3 years Key Performance Metrics  Applicable  EBITDA Cash Flow Per Share Stock Price Appreciation Determination of Performance- Based Payouts  Formulaic Formulaic, plus  Negative Discretion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary is designed to provide competitive levels of compensation to executives based on their responsibilities, performance  and experience, in relation to competitive market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No specific formula is applied to determine the weight of each of these  factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay base salaries because they provide a basic level of compensation and are necessary to recruit and retain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, our CEOs base salary was 94% of the median market, and our NEOs base salaries ranged from 86% to 120% of the  market median based on our current peer group and survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At lower executive levels, base salaries represent a larger portion of total compensation in accordance with our pay philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At  more senior executive levels, a greater portion of overall compensation is progressively replaced with larger variable compensation  opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has historically followed a policy of primarily using performance bonus awards, rather  than base salary to reward outstanding performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary levels are also important because we generally tie the amount of STI and LTI opportunities and a substantial portion of  our retirement benefits to a percentage of each executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO Percentage  Increase (%) 2016 Annual  Base Salary ($) Steven C. Voorhees 0 1,125,000 Ward H. Dickson 3.5 590,000 James B. Porter III 3.3 775,000 Robert A. Feeser 2.0 561,000 Jeffrey W. Chalovich 3.6 530,000 Robert K. Beckler 2.6 590,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Voorhees did not receive a  salary adjustment in fiscal 2016  because his salary was reviewed  and adjusted immediately after  the Combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Feeser  and Chalovich received salary  adjustments in fiscal 2017 in  connection with their promotions  in September 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual executive bonus program is designed to motivate senior executives and reward the achievement of specific  performance goals that support our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual bonus goals are established for each of the executives who  participate in the program, including each of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our philosophy of paying for performance, an NEOs  performance-based compensation rises and falls with our overall performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The size of the target annual executive bonus program opportunities are designed to provide competitive levels of compensation  to executives based upon their experience, duties and scope of responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target awards are based on a percentage of the  executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount actually paid to an executive under the annual executive bonus program is a function of the following variables:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executives target bonus opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the goals established by the Compensation Committee for the executive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for each goal, the attainment of minimum achievement levels (threshold), capped by maximum achievement levels, and the Compensation Committees determination of the extent to which the executives goals were met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards earned under the annual executive bonus program are contingent upon continued employment with us through the end of  the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the primary performance goals for each of our NEOs were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Productivity Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assigned the greatest weighting  to EBITDA because we believe maximizing EBITDA over the long- term will drive stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the Combination, we set a goal of achieving $1 billion  of synergies and performance improvements by the end of  fiscal 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee added productivity  improvement goals for fiscal 2016 because realizing these synergy  and performance improvements is an important element of our  business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of our STI, EBITDA is calculated as operating income  adjusted to exclude
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) depreciation and amortization,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) costs of  discontinued operations or closed plants,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) certain severance  costs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) LIFO expense,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) expenses or income from conforming  accounting policies or income statement impact from mergers  and acquisitions,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) acquisition inventory step-up,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) expenses  from certain litigation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) extraordinary items,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) asset  impairment charges,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) certain pension expenses and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xi) new  accounting pronouncements, cumulative effect of accounting  changes and prior period accounting errors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The productivity goals comprise two equally weighted  components: realized improvements and run rate improvements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of September 30, 2016, we had realized $384 million of  synergies and performance improvements and had achieved a run  rate of $500 million of synergies and performance improvements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these results exceeded the maximum goals set by the  Compensation Committee, resulting in payouts at the maximum  level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, we generated EBITDA of $2,380.2 million, which  exceeded the target goal set by the Compensation Committee for the component of our NEOs annual bonus opportunities related  to consolidated EBITDA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our superior performance in relation  to EBITDA resulted in awards that were greater than the target  opportunity of this component of each of our NEOs bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer Engagement Survey Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer engagement ratings are an important component  of our performance goals because they provide us with an  objective measure of how our customers view the quality of our  products, the level of our service and the value they receive from  conducting business with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, we engaged  Gallup, an independent market research firm, to conduct our  annual customer engagement surveys, which report on a scale of  1 to 5 with 5 being the most favorable rating.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We place a high value and emphasis on safety and therefore use  our safety results as an important component of the bonus goals  of our NEOs, other than Mr. Dickson, who has no responsibility  over manufacturing operations and therefore does not directly  oversee our safety efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The safety goals comprise two equally weighted components:  the number of workers compensation claims (TWCC) and  the severity of injuries as measured by the number of workdays  lost due to injuries (LWD).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each component is calculated by  multiplying the total number of occurrences in fiscal 2016 by  200,000 (representing the number of hours 100 employees work  in a year) and dividing by the hours actually worked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The customer survey results for the consolidated Company  exceeded the target bonus opportunity for this component of the  annual bonuses of Messrs. Voorhees and Dickson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The customer  survey results of our Corrugated Container business exceeded  the maximum bonus score for that category, resulting in Mr.  Chalovich receiving the maximum percentage of that component  of his bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The customer survey results for each of our Paper  Solutions and our Consumer, India and Brazil businesses  exceeded the threshold bonus scores for that category, resulting  in Messrs. Porter and Feeser each receiving an amount between  the threshold percentage and target percentage of that  component of their respective bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variances in our overall safety results both as a company and  by business resulted in differing rewards for our NEOs who are  rewarded for favorable safety results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fiscal 2016 bonus goals for Messrs. Voorhees and Dickson were based exclusively on consolidated Company measures because  their positions had a substantial impact on the achievement of those measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fiscal 2016 bonus goals for Messrs. Porter,  Feeser and Chalovich were based on a combination of consolidated Company measures (e.g., EBITDA and productivity) and  measures focused on the results of the businesses they oversaw (e.g., customer engagement, safety and EBITDA, in the case of  Messrs. Feeser and Chalovich).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the bonus goals for each of the NEOs were modified from the fiscal 2015 goals to focus on EBITDA and productivity  improvement, both realized and run rate, with respect to our Company as a whole for all of our NEOs and to remove the factors  related to home office cost reductions for Mr. Dickson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our focus on customer engagement and safety continues to be a factor in  our fiscal 2016 bonus goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets performance goals and related performance benchmarks at the beginning of each fiscal year, and  as needed to account for changes in the Company after considering managements recommendations, the confidential business plan  and the budget for that fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets the required performance benchmark to achieve a maximum  payout for a particular performance goal at ambitious levels that can only be attained when applicable results are exceptional and  which justify the higher award payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set goals at a level where we expect an executive to achieve a maximum payout with  respect to a particular performance goal one or two years out of ten.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, we set goals at a level where we expect an executive to  achieve a threshold payout or less with respect to a particular performance goal one or two years out of ten.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential bonus payouts under our annual executive bonus program depend on the level at which the performance benchmarks  are achieved as set forth in the table below, based on a percentage of the executives base salary at the end of the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  failure to achieve at least a threshold performance benchmark with respect to a particular bonus goal will result in no payout for  that portion of the bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The achievement in excess of the maximum performance benchmark with respect to a particular bonus  goal will result in a maximum payout for that bonus goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The achievement in excess of the threshold performance benchmark  with respect to a particular bonus goal, but at a level below the maximum performance benchmark, will result in a payout based on  straight-line linear interpolation for that bonus goal between the relevant benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for assessing actual performance relative to performance benchmarks for each goal  and, in doing so, determines and certifies the amount of any final bonus payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee  determined and certified that the NEOs achieved overall performance benchmarks resulting in the executive bonus payout as a  percentage of their salaries at the end of the fiscal year or the end of the applicable period set forth by their respective names shown below in the column entitled Actual 2016 Executive Bonus Payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives (LTI)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We emphasize long-term variable compensation at the senior executive level over short-term variable compensation because of  our desire to reward effective long-term management decision-making and our desire to attract and retain executives who have the potential to positively impact our long-term profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives are designed to allow us to focus attention on the  successful execution of our long-term business strategy and future returns to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, LTI awards consisted primarily of performance-based stock (80% of the award value) and stock options (20% of the  award value).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the combination of performance-based restricted stock with stock options is a strong at-risk, long- term incentive portfolio that provides strong alignment among our stock price performance, our management teams long-term  execution of our strategic plan and the long-term incentive amounts actually realized by our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee may grant LTI awards at any of its scheduled meetings or by unanimous written consent, it  generally grants awards for executives at its January or February meeting each year, except for awards related to promotions or  new hires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants approved during scheduled meetings become effective and are priced as of the date of approval or as of a pre- determined future date based on a date of hire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants approved by unanimous written consent become effective and are priced as  of a pre-determined future date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stock options have a per-share exercise price equal to the closing stock price of Common Stock  on the NYSE on the effective date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Restricted Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based stock is designed to reward and retain our executives by offering them the opportunity to receive shares of  Common Stock upon achieving pre-determined performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based restricted stock awards have a  service condition and a performance condition based on our achievement of a certain cash flow per share during the three- year period beginning January 1, 2016 and ending on December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the satisfaction of the applicable service  requirement, the actual number of shares that will vest pursuant to the grants made on February 2, 2016 will be a percentage of the  respective target awards based on cash flow per share as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Flow Per Share Percent of Target Award (%)   4.00 200  3.40 but < 4.00 100  2.50 but < 3.40 50 < 2.50 0
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards for performance between these goal levels will be interpolated on a linear basis; provided performance in excess of 200% of the target goal level will not result in vesting in excess of 200% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow per share is calculated as our cash flow (as defined below), divided by three, divided by the average of the diluted  weighted average shares outstanding during the 12 quarters in the period beginning January 1, 2016 and ending December 31,  2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term cash flow means our net cash provided by operating activities, as set forth in our statements of cash flow during  the period beginning on January 1, 2016 and ending December 31, 2018, minus the actual amount of capital expenditures, as  set forth in our statements of cash flow up to $2.4 billion, excluding certain contemplated capital expenditures, during the period  beginning January 1, 2016 and ending December 31, 2018, plus the sum of all items included in the investing activities section of  our statements of cash flow during the period beginning January 1, 2016 and ending December 31, 2018, but excluding amounts  shown for capital expenditures, cash paid or received for purchase of businesses, investments in subsidiaries or cash received in  merger, plus the after-tax impact of any cash payments made in connection with certain litigation, plus the after-tax cash impact  of any merger-related and spin-off related integration and restructuring costs or payments, plus 25% (or our actual ownership  percentage, if different than 25%) of the free cash flow of our joint venture with Grupo Gondi, minus, in the sole discretion of the  Compensation Committee, the actual amount of capital expenditures as set forth in our statements of cash flow over $2.40 billion  during the period beginning January 1, 2016 and ending December 31, 2018, minus, in the sole discretion of the Compensation  Committee, the cumulative effect of an acquisition with total consideration of $500 million or more, plus the after-tax impact of any  cash payments relating to any multi-employer pension plan, other than normal pension contributions, plus any cash payments  resulting from the prepayment of the Plum Creek Timber Note Holdings debt, minus in the sole discretion of the Compensation  Committee, an amount up to $180 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based restricted stock granted in fiscal 2016 is scheduled to vest on February 2, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It provides for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) dividend  equivalent rights to be credited to the recipient prior to vesting,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) early vesting in the event of a change in control and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) no  voting rights prior to vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of stock options directly aligns the interests of our executives with those of our stockholders because options only have  value if the price of our Common Stock on the exercise date exceeds the stock price on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock options are granted  at fair market value, vest in equal installments on the first, second and third anniversaries of the grant date and have a 10-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide certain retirement benefits to our NEOs in order to provide financial security in retirement and attract and retain high  quality senior executives.
